messages.subject: Re: Chat 6/6 + Emperor's New Food article
messages.msgSnippet: Sunday! Yes! I ll be there to listen in. I ll try not to make too much noise so as not to distract. :O) Oh you don t know about that java chat feature! It s
messages.messageBody:
Sunday! Yes! I'll be there to "listen" in. I'll try not to make too
much noise so as not to distract. :O)

Oh you don't know about that java chat feature! It's evil... It will
do all sort of things like throw us out or make all letters
invisible... And just a heads up (and I'm serious about this), try
not to use two character smilies like this :)
When I did that it threw me out... All four times I did a smiley.
Must be all the Ishin spirits coming over and hating smilies
intended for Saitou, Hijikata and Sano...

See you then... Thanks for making time for us!

Anyway, I'll be there Sunday. See(?) you all then!

-MissBehavin

7:00 pm? I can try showing up... though this Sunday I
will be in one of the presentations scheduled for this
month, hopefully it will be over before 6:00 pm.
Perhaps I will end up showing a little later (like
8:00 pm?), but I will try my best to show up.

shouldn't have any problem with connection or the
like.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Chat 6/6 + Emperor's New Food article
messages.msgSnippet: ... Captain Sagara would like to remind everyone that he and the Somo Roshitai are always looking for opportunities to set fires and create general mayhem.
messages.messageBody:
Shimazu Masayoshi <patriot014@...> wrote:

>> "Samurai, farmer, artisan, or trader,
>> Oldster, youngster, boy or girl
>> Clever or stupid, poor or elite.
>> You won't get civilized if you don't eat meat!"
>>
>NOTICE --- His Illustrious Excellency the Lord Shogun >Tokugawa Yoshinobu wishes it known that the person who wrote >this unspeakably atrocious excuse for a poem will be captured >by the Shinsengumi, very slowly tortured, and then tied to a >very large stone and drowned in the inner moat of Edo Castle.

Captain Sagara would like to remind everyone that he and the Somo Roshitai are always looking for opportunities to set fires and create general mayhem. Being oppressed? Figure your literary efforts are at least as good as Shinsengumi Vice Commander Hijikata's? Trouble with bakufu pests? Contact Saigou Takamori to make arrangements. All forms of cash taken (literally). In an emergency, contact Suzuki Mikisaburou, our Shinsengumi representative, in Kyoto.

phil

messages.subject: Re: Chat 6/6 + Emperor's New Food article
messages.msgSnippet: ... NOTICE  --- His Illustrious Excellency the Lord Shogun Tokugawa Yoshinobu wishes it known that the person who wrote this unspeakably atrocious excuse for a
messages.messageBody:
> "Samurai, farmer, artisan, or trader,
> Oldster, youngster, boy or girl
> Clever or stupid, poor or elite.
> You won't get civilized if you don't eat meat!"
>
NOTICE --- His Illustrious Excellency the Lord Shogun Tokugawa
Yoshinobu wishes it known that the person who wrote this unspeakably
atrocious excuse for a poem will be captured by the Shinsengumi, very
slowly tortured, and then tied to a very large stone and drowned in
the inner moat of Edo Castle.

--M.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Chat 6/6 + Emperor's New Food article
messages.msgSnippet: I would like to propose a tentative chat session for Sunday June 6th New York 6:00 pm Los Angeles 3:00 pm Chicago 5:00 pm Sao Paulo/Buenos Aires 7:00 pm I m
messages.messageBody:
I would like to propose a tentative chat session for
Sunday June 6th

New York 6:00 pm
Los Angeles 3:00 pm
Chicago 5:00 pm
Sao Paulo/Buenos Aires 7:00 pm

I'm keeping my fingers crossed that is doesn't overlap with the
satellite/cable broadcast of the NHK Taiga Shinsengumi

It's on from 8 to 8:45-8:50 on the East Coast. I think it's on saturdays in CA.

# # #

"Samurai, farmer, artisan, or trader,
Oldster, youngster, boy or girl
Clever or stupid, poor or elite.
You won't get civilized if you don't eat meat!"

NOTICE ---Vice Chief Hijikata would like everyone to know that he is NOT the author of that atrocious poem despite his progressiveness concerning the Shinsengumi dinner menu.

Captain Okita would like to remind everyone that pork products are not to be considered meat. Ever.

Captain Nagakura insists that there is nothing whatsoever wrong with using misshapen vegetables in any stew containing meat.

Captain Saitou advises one and all that plain hot soba is in fact the best choice for meals. Always.









--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.msgSnippet: I would like to propose a tentative chat session for Sunday June 6th New York 6:00 pm Los Angeles 3:00 pm Chicago 5:00 pm Sao Paulo/Buenos Aires 7:00 pm I m
messages.messageBody:
I would like to propose a tentative chat session for
Sunday June 6th

New York 6:00 pm
Los Angeles 3:00 pm
Chicago 5:00 pm
Sao Paulo/Buenos Aires 7:00 pm

I'm keeping my fingers crossed that is doesn't overlap with the
satellite/cable broadcast of the NHK Taiga Shinsengumi
--------------------------------

EXCELLENT article about food diplomacy >> court feasts + banquets
for foreign dignitaries...downright humorous at times and deals with
1850s-1880s

M. William Steele "Alternative Narratives in Modern Japanese History"
isbn 0415305705
chapter "The emperor's new food" from page 110-132

***if anyone is going to use this chapter for a term paper or
something be sure to get full citation info from an online library
or something***

http://www.streamload.com/secretarytocapt3
file name "SteeleEmperorsNewFood"
password makoto
file size: 2.77 MB(black+white bitmap but good quality)

page 123
"Samurai, farmer, artisan, or trader,
Oldster, youngster, boy or girl
Clever or stupid, poor or elite.
You won't get civilized if you don't eat meat!"
